item.title: 7 crows ripping open rubbish bags, 26th July
item.description:

item.title: Unknown person occupying our parking, 26th July
item.description:
The vehicle in picture has been illegally occupying our parking space intermittently, without asking/seeking permission. Earlier when my car was parked here, a lady (owner of this vehicle I suspect) wanted to park her and tried physically assaulting and there by scaring my wife for this. Post this I contacted my letting agency and was confirmed the parking belongs to our property 65, Hartslock Dr. I pasted this information for some time on the window. Now after 2 months, we’re in the same scuffle. Hence require assistance with the violation as we need the space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartslock Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 26th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Reaston Street, New Cross Gate, London

item.title: Private street cleaner blocking footpath, 26th July
item.description:
A private company is cleaning the street and harness window cleaning ( the building above the Pret A Manger) and have fully blocked the footpath and there is no where for any pedestrians to walk or to cross the road to get to a safe footpath so pedestrians are just walking into traffic. Buses are driving by right beside people it’s extremely unsafe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 190, Strand, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsing pavement - rapidly escalating, 26th July
item.description:
Over the last few weeks, paving slabs have started to collapse outside my property and that next door. There has been a rapid escalation over the last week and there is now a number of slabs that are very uneven and a whole section of pavement that is now creaking, moving and collapsing under foot. This is a very well used footpath and its a matter of time before someone falls or trips over and has an accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, De Laune Street, Kennington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
